item.description:
In coordination with their new exhibit, A New World: England?s First View of America, the British Art Museum will be screening the one of the true 90's movie classics.......The Last of the Mohicans

For those who haven't seen this before, the movie is based on James Fenimore Cooper's classic novel about the American wilderness in the 1750's. It starts Daniel Day-Lewis as Hawkeye, a white man adopted by one of the two remaining members of the Mohican tribe who defends British soldiers during the French and Indian War.

Entrance to the museum and the movie screening are free

I (Jeanie) will be in the lobby at 1:45, if you can't find me...call 203-494-3518....but if you've never been to the museum before, it's worth it to stop by a little earlier and see some of the fantastic exhibits they have on display.
item.name: Guess they weren't really the last now were they?
